headline: Watch: Reporter clashes with J.D. Vance for 'propagating and promoting white resentment'
author: David Edwards
sentences:
At a campaign stop in Ohio on Monday, Hillyard asked Vance why he had chosen to campaign with controversial figures like Charlie Kirk, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and Donald Trump Jr.
Vaughn noted that Kirk recently claimed there is "an undeniable War on White People in The West."
Vaughn pressed Vance: "By choosing Marjorie Taylor Greene, by choosing Charlie Kirk, who has said those words, you are promoting and propagating white resentment."
"We dont agree on everything and the idea that you'd impute every single view of a person's friends or a person's supporters all to them is a game the media plays.
"This is a game the media plays where, by having friends, you assume that I have every single viewpoint that those people have.
"I bring Charlie here because I think he's a great warrior for the conservative movement and because we agree on most things!"
"By stoking white resentment here, instead of appealing to people's better angels, why?"
NBC News correspondent Vaughn Hillyard confronted Republican U.S. Senate candidate J.D.
But Kirk, who was standing nearby, would not let Vance answer the question.
"If you've got a question for me, you can talk to me afterward."
Vance for "propagating and promoting white resentment."
"I reject the premise of the question," Vance replied.
I'm going to play that game."
